name: Orc Marauders
background:
Orc Marauders are hulking humanoid aliens, whose society is divided into a number of warring clans and bands. Orc Marauders lack precision weapons or heavy armour and instead rely on their fast vehicles, large numbers and ferocity to defeat their foes.

Orc Clans have been in conflict since the beginning of their history. Only the threat of the expansionist Dwarven Guilds could make the Orcs unite. These Orcs felt a pride they never had before, only for the Guilds to activate the Radiance Cascade. In an instant, their leaders, most of their worlds and even their greatest enemy were destroyed. Now, the scattered Orcs strive to rebuild what was lost.
backgroundFull:
The Orcs came from a barren and harsh world where their survival was a constant struggle. These Orcs became used to lives of hardship, fighting the elements and each other. For these Orcs, honour, strength and their clans were the most important parts of their lives. Clans would work together to share their meagre resources, fighting everyone else. Larger groups rarely lasted, instead Orcs put their faith in personal trust and bonds. Without a worthy leader, larger groups would dissolve back into clans and return to fighting each other.

Despite their lack of unity, the Orcs would eventually make it to space, where they found worlds where they could thrive. Clans moved quickly to spread out and claim their territories. By the time the Elves met the Orcs, they had already settled a large portion of Sirius. Orc clans' conflicts and raids would often spill into Elf territory, and so the Elves began to strike deals with certain clans to encourage the Orcs to fight among themselves.

This changed when the Elves offered their border worlds to the Dwarves. Tensions rose quickly as the Orcs’ new neighbours responded to raids by conquering entire systems in retaliation. As Dwarves began expanding more aggressively, the Orc Clans were forced to set aside their differences and unite. These combined Orc forces proved more powerful than anyone had anticipated and the Dwarves were forced to retreat.

United for the first time in their history, the Orcs felt a renewed sense of pride as they drove into Dwarven territory. On the edge of defeat, the Dwarves used an invention which scourged the sector, in an event known as the Radiance Cascade. It destroyed numerous worlds and both Orc and Dwarven fleets. With their leadership and most of their leaders lost in an instant, the Orcs were suddenly scattered into a number of Clans. Many of their former worlds were settled by human arrivals, brought to Sirius by the Dwarven invention. The Orc clans were forced to retreat into the edge of their former territory. 

Though decimated and scattered by the Cascade, the Orcs remain proud. Some hope to reunite the Clans through conquest while others still hope to discover those lost in the Cascade.

How will you reunite the scattered clans?

spells.name: Elder Protection
spells.effect: Pick up to two friendly units within 12", which get Resistance once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Death Bolt
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 6", which takes 1 hit with AP(2) and Impale.

spells.name: Path of War
spells.effect: Pick up to four friendly units within 12", which get Ferocious Boost once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration

spells.name: Crackling Bolt

specialRules.name: Unique
specialRules.description: This unit may only be taken once per army.

specialRules.name: Protected
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 6+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: Repel Ambushers
specialRules.description: Enemy units using Ambush must be set up over 12" away from this model's unit.

specialRules.name: Crossing Barrage
specialRules.description: Once per activation, when this model moves through enemy units, pick one of them and roll X dice. For each 4+ it takes 3 hits with AP(1).

specialRules.name: Shielded
specialRules.description: Units where all models have this rule get +1 to defense rolls against hits that are not from spells.

specialRules.name: Shred
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 1 to block hits, this weapon deals 1 extra wound.

specialRules.name: Mend
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick one friendly model within 3" with Tough, and remove D3 wounds from it.

specialRules.name: Bad Shot
specialRules.description: This model gets -1 to hit rolls when shooting.

specialRules.name: Ferocious
specialRules.description: When attacking, unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Ferocious Boost Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Ferocious Boost. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Precision Charge Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get +1 to hit rolls when charging. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Shooter Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Unpredictable Shooter. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Speed Feat Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Speed Feat. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Ferocious Boost
specialRules.description: If this model has Ferocious, it deals extra hits on successful unmodified hit results of 5-6 from Ferocious (instead of only on 6).

specialRules.name: Regeneration Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Regeneration. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Hit & Run Fighter Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Hit & Run Fighter. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Bounding
specialRules.description: When this unit is activated, you may place all models with this rule in it anywhere fully within D3+1" of their position.

specialRules.name: Ranged Shrouding Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Ranged Shrouding. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Surge
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 6 to hit, this weapon deals 1 extra hits (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Impale
specialRules.description: Against non-Hero units with Tough(3) or more, this weapon gets Deadly(+3).

specialRules.name: Rending in Melee Mark
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 enemy units within 18", which friendly units gets Rending in melee against once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Piercing Fighter Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get AP(+1) in melee. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Piercing Assault
specialRules.description: This model gets AP(+1) when charging.

specialRules.name: Ambush
specialRules.description: May be set aside before deployment. At the start of any round after the first, may be deployed anywhere over 9” away from enemy units. Players alternate in placing Ambush units, starting with the player that activates next. Units that deploy via Ambush can’t seize or contest objectives on the round they deploy.

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Tough
specialRules.description: This model only rolls to check wound effects once it has taken at least X wounds, and is only Knocked Out on rolls of 5+X or more.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable
specialRules.description: When attacking, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Shooter
specialRules.description: When shooting, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Speed Feat
specialRules.description: Once per game, when this unit moves and all its models have this rule, you may use this rule so that they move +3" when using Advance actions and +6" when using Rush/Charge actions.

specialRules.name: Regeneration
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 5+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: Hit & Run
specialRules.description: Once per round, units where all models have this rule may move by up to 3" after shooting or being in melee.

specialRules.name: Hit & Run Fighter
specialRules.description: Once per round, units where all models have this rule may move by up to 3" after being in melee.

specialRules.name: Ranged Shrouding
specialRules.description: Enemies get -6" range when trying to shoot units where all models have this rule.

specialRules.name: Deadly
specialRules.description: Assign each wound to one model, and multiply it by X. Hits from Deadly must be resolved first, and these wounds don’t carry over to other models if the original target is killed.

specialRules.name: Rending
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and on unmodified results of 6 to hit, those hits get AP(+4).

specialRules.name: Blast
specialRules.description: Ignores cover, and after resolving other special rules, each hit is multiplied by X, where X is up to as many hits as enemy models in the target unit and within 3” of it. Hits must be split evenly between all enemy units within 3” of any model from the target (defender picks how).

specialRules.name: Resistance
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 6+ it is ignored. If the wounds were from a spell, then they are ignored on a 2+ instead.

specialRules.name: Bane
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and when attacking the target must re-roll unmodified Defense results of 6.
